intro: Cyrtandra buttii, commonly known as the Hawaiian violet, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Cyrtandra buttii has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and hummingbirds. It is considered an important species in Hawaiian flora and is often found in protected habitats.
